Title: Application of P3SPS in insert infotainment program on trans TV
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakart, 11480, Indonesia; Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, S.A., Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakart, 11480, Indonesia; Muslikhin, M., Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The Broadcasting Code of Conduct (P3) is the provisions for broadcasters set by the Indonesian Broadcasting Commission (KPI). Broadcast Program Standards (SPS) is a broadcast content standard that contains the restriction, violation, and obligation set by the KPI. Insert is an infotainment program that aired on Trans TV. This study aimed to describe how the application of Broadcasting Behavior Guidelines and Broadcast Program Standards (P3SPS) on Infotainment Insert program in Trans TV. This study used descriptive qualitative method and used three stages of coding test, starting with open coding then axial coding and in proceed with selective coding, and do interviews and also observation. Based on research conducted, still found violations against P3SPS made by Insert program. That is in Article P3 Clause 9 and SPS Clause 9 concerning the right of privacy, then Article P3 Clause 14 and SPS Clause 15 on the value and norms of decency. © 2019, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Application; Infotainment; P3SPS; Political Economy Communication; Violation
References: (2008) Strategi Mengelola Radio Dan Televisi, , Jakarta: Kencana Prenada Media Group; Syahputra, I., (2006) Jurnalistik Infotainment Kancah Baru Junalistik Dalam Industri Televisi, , Yogyakarta: Pikir Media; Nugroho, B., Imawan, T., (2005) Infotainmen, , Jakarta: Komisi Penyiaran Indonesia; Moleong, L.J., (2004) Metedologi Penelitian Kualitatif, , Bandung: Remaja Rosdakarya; Baran, J.S., Davis, K.D., (2010) Teori Komunikasi Massa: Dasar, Pergolakan Dan Masa Depan, , Jakarta: Rekatama Media; Suwandi, B., (2008) Memahami Penelitian Kualitatif, , Jakarta: Rineke Cipta; Syah, S., (2011) Rambu-Rambu Jurnalistik Dari Undang-Undang Hingga Hati Nurani, , Jakarta: Pustaka Pelajar; Nurfikria, I., Tawulo, T., Asrul, M., (2018) Srul,Iadang Konflik Dalam Tayangan Televisi (Kajian Terhadap Program Acara Pagi-Pagi Pasti Happy Di Trans Tv),S J. Ris. Komun, , JURKOM), Sulawesi; (2007) Haryatmoko, Etika Komunikasi Manipulasi Media, Kekerasan, Dan Pornografi, , Yogyakarta: PT. Kansius

Title: The influence of indian drama in TV on behaviour of fashion imitation of housewives
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Deviana, L., Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muslikhin, M., Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Research Objectives, to find out whether or not the influence of Indian Drama Impressions in the Antv on Fashion Imitation Behaviour of Housewives in Cipadu Tangerang Village and to find out how big the influence is. The research method used in this research is quantitative method by giving questionnaires to respondents to get research results. The results of the research are presented with tables and numbers that represent the answers of each respondent. The Results Achieved, which Indian Drama Impressions have an influence on the Imitation Fashion Behaviour of 43.2%. The conclusions of Indian Drama show 43.2% of Imitation Fashion Behaviour, the remaining 56.8% are influenced by other factors which are not discussed further in this research. © 2019, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
References: Ardianto, K., (2012) Bandung: Simbiosa Rekatama Media, , Bandung: Simbiosa Rekatama Media; Soenarto, R., (2007) Metode Penelitian Kuantitatif, , Jakarta: FFTV-IKJ Press; Griffin, G., (2004) Komitmen Organisasi, , Jakarta: Erlangga; Ahmadi, A., (2007) Psikologi Sosial, , Jakarta: Rineka Cipta
Publisher: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
